DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Less Than 50 Percent Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred)._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Less Than 50 Percent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredName: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Less Than Integer::50 Percent Unit
Property.preferredDefinition: The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

Concepts.definition: The fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected with each beat. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ReferenceDocuments.name: If cardiac function assessmen
ReferenceDocuments.description: If cardiac function assessment was clinically indicated or performed, was the LVEF less than normal per institutional guidelines, or less than 55%, if threshold for normal is not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines?
